meanings.sent1: His jibbah was prominent, casting a shadow over his eyes.
meanings.sent2: The baby had a tiny jibbah that made him look adorable.
meanings.sent3: The jibbah of the mountain loomed over the valley, as if watching over it.
meanings.sent4: Her jibbah furrowed in concentration as she tried to solve the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The jibbah of the building was so high that it seemed to touch the sky.

meanings.definition: A type of sail on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors hoisted the jibbah to catch the wind and propel the ship forward.
meanings.sent2: The colorful jibbah fluttered in the breeze as the ship sailed into the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The captain adjusted the jibbah to navigate through the rough waters.
meanings.sent4: The jibbah billowed like a giant butterfly as the ship picked up speed.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the jibbah added beauty to the ship's silhouette.

meanings.definition: To refuse to comply or cooperate.
meanings.sent1: She would jibbah every time her parents asked her to clean her room.
meanings.sent2: The stubborn mule would jibbah and refuse to move from the path.
meanings.sent3: The cat would jibbah playfully when it was time to take a bath.
meanings.sent4: The old car would often jibbah and refuse to start on cold mornings.
meanings.sent5: The toddler would jibbah and cross his arms when he didn't want to eat his vegetables.
